example.eg: The glass slipped out of Ian's hand.
example.egtrans: 玻璃杯从他手中滑落。

example.eg: I slipped on the ice and hurt myself.
example.egtrans: 我在冰上滑倒，受了伤。

example.eg: Jeremy slipped on the wet ground, but didn't fall.
example.egtrans: 杰里米在潮湿的地上滑了一下，但没有摔倒。

example.eg: It had rained by the time we got back to the car and, when we tried to drive away, the tyres just kept slipping on the mud.
example.egtrans: 我们回到车上时，天已经下起了雨，当我试图驱车离开时，车轮就一直在泥地里打滑。

example.eg: The grandmother slipped her grandson a sweet.  Veronica's father slipped her a few dollars to pay for her night out.
example.egtrans: 祖母偷偷给孙子了一颗糖。维罗妮卡的爸爸偷偷给她塞了几美元，让她晚上出去玩儿的时候有钱花。

example.eg: Carol's slip resulted in a broken leg.
example.egtrans: 卡罗尔滑了一跤，摔断了一条腿。

example.eg: Maggie is wearing a slip under her dress.
example.egtrans: 玛姬在裙子里还穿了一条衬裙。

example.eg: Forgetting to pass on an important message to his boss was the only slip Jake ever made, but it still cost him his job.
example.egtrans: 杰克忘了给老板传达一条重要信息。这是他犯过的唯一一次错，但却因此被开除了。

example.eg: A slip in attention while driving can have tragic consequences.
example.egtrans: 驾驶过程中一时的疏忽都可能酿成惨剧。

example.eg: The dancer's slip ruined the entire performance.
example.egtrans: 舞者失足的一步毁掉了整场演出。

example.eg: The ship glided into the slip.
example.egtrans: 那艘船泊进了码头。

example.eg: We need new slips for the bed, as these are falling apart.
example.egtrans: 我们需要新的枕套，现在这些都破破烂烂了。

example.eg: The receptionist handed me a slip with the date of my next appointment on it.
Bobby is just a slip of a boy.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 小, 小人, 小家伙

example.eg: Julia applied slip to the vase she was making.
Once you have children, the years just slip by.
example.egtrans: 一旦你有了孩子，就能感觉到时光飞逝。

example.eg: Prices may slip a little after the tourist season.
example.egtrans: 旅游旺季之后，价格会稍微下降一些。

example.eg: The player slipped some from his outstanding play last year.
example.egtrans: 跟去年出色的表现相比，那名球员退步了一些。

example.eg: He slipped by telling them where their daughter was.
example.egtrans: 他无意中说出了他们女儿的下落。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 偶然提起某事，无意中说起

example.eg: He did a good job, but slipped in a couple of cases.
example.egtrans: 他做得不错，不过有几处失误了。

example.eg: He slipped into the shadows.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 逝去, 消失, 不复存在

example.eg: He slipped the necklace over her head.
The sailor slipped the rope from its knot.
He slipped the subject of marriage into the conversation.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 偶然提到, 无意说起

dsense.name: slip [sth]
dsense.guideword: (slide: open or shut) (以滑动的方式)

example.eg: She smoothly slipped the door shut.
The boat slipped its moorings.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 无意中说出…，无意中透露…

example.eg: I hate saying goodbye to everyone at the end of a party so I usually just slip away.
example.egtrans: 我讨厌派对结束后与每个人一一道别，所以我通常都悄悄溜走。

example.eg: I was trying to finish the exam, but time was just slipping away.
example.egtrans: 我努力想做完考卷，但时间还是不知不觉地流逝。

example.eg: The image of the ghost slipped away before her eyes.
example.egtrans: 幽灵的影像就在她眼前逐渐消失。

example.eg: Three hours after her stroke, she slipped away.
example.egtrans: 中风发作三小时后，她便离世了。

example.eg: The old woman slipped back into her deep depression.
I slipped back into line before the teacher noticed I had even gone.
After reading the secret document, he slipped it back into its folder.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 很快掠过, 飞掠而过

example.eg: The thieves managed to slip by the security guard and steal the painting.
I'm going to slip off these riding boots and put on more comfortable sandals.
She slipped off to go see her boyfriend before her parents could protest.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 溜走, 溜掉, 溜出去

dsense.name: slip [sth] on, slip on [sth]
dsense.guideword: informal (clothing: put on quickly) (非正式用语)

example.eg: I dashed upstairs to slip on something less formal.
example.egtrans: 我冲上楼，快速换上一身不那么正式的衣服。

example.eg: She waited until no one was looking, then quietly slipped out through the back door.
example.egtrans: 她趁没人注意，悄悄从后门溜了出去。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 悄悄溜走, 悄悄溜出去

example.eg: He slipped out of the meeting and headed home.
example.egtrans: 他悄悄地从会议中溜走，回家去了。

example.eg: The $100 bill must have slipped out of my pocket; I don't have it anymore.
example.egtrans: 那张100美元的钞票肯定从我口袋里滑落了，再也没有了。

example.eg: I didn't want to spoil the surprise, it just slipped out.
example.egtrans: 我也不想毁了惊喜，但还是无意中泄露了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 无意中泄露, 不慎说出

example.eg: Let me slip out of this monkey suit.
example.egtrans: 快让我脱掉这礼服。

dsense.name: slip over to [sth]
dsense.guideword: US, informal (make a short trip to)

example.eg: I'm going to slip over to the store to get some milk.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 去...短期旅行, 快速去一趟

example.eg: The young lovers slipped over to the lake for some privacy.
I thought I had a hold of it, but it just slipped through my fingers.
James was coming down the stairs when he slipped up and fell.
example.egtrans: 詹姆斯在下楼的时候脚下一滑摔倒了。

example.eg: Sorry, I slipped up when I calculated how much I owe you.
example.egtrans: 抱歉，我在计算欠你多少钱时出错了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 疏忽, 疏漏, 出错

example.eg: The cash machine had run out of deposit slips again.  Most checkbooks come with a few deposit slips.

dsense.name: fall through the cracks, slip through the cracks

trans_examp.trans_cn: 未加注意，疏忽，粗心大意
弗洛伊德式错误, 弗洛伊德式口误

dsense.name: give [sb] the slip, give the slip to [sb]
late slip
dsense.guideword: (school: form filled in on late arrival) (学校)

dsense.name: permission slip
dsense.guideword: (authorization signed by parent or guardian) (家长同意孩子在学校等机构的监管下参与活动)

example.eg: She had to ask her mother to sign her permission slip before she could attend the symphony performance with the rest of her class.

dsense.name: pink slip
dsense.guideword: US, informal (termination of employment) (非正式用语)

example.eg: I've worked hard there for years, but today they gave me my pink slip.

dsense.name: pink slip
dsense.guideword: US, informal, regional (certificate of vehicle ownership) (美国)

example.eg: Most authors receive a lot of rejection slips before they finally get published.

dsense.name: slip down
dsense.guideword: (in a ranking, etc.: drop in position) (排行等)

example.eg: I can slip you in this afternoon between my other appointments.

dsense.name: slip [sth] in, slip in [sth]
dsense.guideword: informal, figurative (activity, event: fit into schedule) (指计划或日程)

example.eg: She waited until no one was looking, then quietly slipped in through the back door.
Give me a minute to get out of my work clothes and slip into something more comfortable.
Martin slipped quietly into the conference room as the meeting had started.
Jennifer slipped the birthday card into the envelope.  Morris slipped the key into his pocket.
The gun slipped easily into its holster.
This camera slips into a pocket or small purse.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 轻松塞入, 轻松放进

example.eg: The empire was slowly slipping into chaos before his eyes.
How can my favourite vase have slipped off the mantelpiece?
She slipped on the icy pavement and broke her hip.
example.egtrans: 她滑倒在结冰的人行道上，摔坏了股骨。

example.eg: The glove slipped easily over his hand.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 把…套在（某物上）, 给（某人）披上, 给...穿上

dsense.name: slip road
dsense.guideword: UK (ramp: to enter or exit a highway) (高速公路)

example.eg: I was planning to go to the store, but it slipped my mind.
The door was left opened and I think we can slip through it without being seen.
A slip-up in defence allowed Soldado to score the winning goal.
example.egtrans: 防守上的一点疏漏使索尔达多成功射入制胜一球。

example.eg: I missed the meeting; it slipped my mind.
The scouts learned how to tie slipknots and square knots.
The politician has apologized for a verbal slip-up that he says was not meant to offend.
